name: Morrocan Carrot and Chickpea Salad
description: A beauty of a carrot salad - tricked out with chickpeas, chunks of dried pluots, sliced almonds, and a toasted cumin dressing. Thank you Diane Morgan.
ingredients: 1/3 cup / 80 ml extra virgin olive oil
1/2 teaspoon fine sea salt, plus more to taste
10 ounces carrots, shredded on a box grater or sliced whisper thin on a mandolin
2 cups cooked chickpeas (or one 15- ounce can, drained and rinsed)
2/3 cup / 100 g  dried pluots, plums, or dates cut into chickpea-sized pieces
For serving: lots of toasted almond slices, dried or fresh rose petals - all optional (but great additions!)

name: Pomegranate Yogurt Bowl
description: A simple breakfast bowl made with Greek yogurt, fresh pomegranate juice, puffed quinoa cereal, toasted sunflower seeds, and honey.
ingredients: a big dollop of Greek yogurt
a handful of puffed quinoa crisps (or other cereal/granola)
optional: whole pomegranate seeds or fresh/dried rose petals, a bit of bee pollen

name: Za'atar
description: Za'atar is an incredibly versatile Middle Eastern spice blend, one of my favorites. Particularly this time of year when it's a welcome addition to all sorts of roasted vegetables, soups and stews, or simply sprinkled over everything from yogurt, to eggs, to savory granola.
ingredients: 4 tablespoons fresh thyme leaves, stripped from stems (or equivalent dried)
scant 1/2 teaspoon fine sea salt, or to taste

name: Seeded Popovers
description: Popovers are the most delightful thing my oven produces - sky-high and billowy. Here's my go-to recipe, a few tips, and the overall technique I use.
recipeYield: Makes 6-8 large popovers, or more smaller ones..
ingredients: 2 cups / 9 ounces / 255 g unbleached all-purpose flour
1/4 cup / 1.5 oz / 45 g raw, uncooked millet seeds*
2 tablespoons / .5 oz / 15 g toasted sesame seeds*
2 tablespoons / .5 oz / 15 g toasted sunflower seeds*

name: Kale Rice Bowl
description: A quick lunchtime brown rice bowl with kale, capers, salted yogurt, za'atar, toasted sesame seeds - and a poached egg for good measure.
ingredients: - capers, rinsed, dried, and pan-fried until blistered in butter
- a dollop of salted greek yogurt
- a big drizzle of good extra-virgin olive oil

name: Marjoram Sauce with Capers & Green Olives
description: Pungent, herby, and assertive, this is an incredibly versatile sauce. From Deborah Madison's new book, Vegetable Literacy, it's made with pounded capers, walnuts, green olives, and a load of herbs - the perfect slather for everything from sandwiches and pasta to egg salad and vegetables.
ingredients: 1 thick slice country bread, crust removed
1/2 cups / 1 1/2 oz / 45 g pine nuts or walnuts
1 cup / 1 1/4 oz / 35 g finely chopped parsley

name: An Ideal Lunch Salad
description: There's all sorts of good stuff in this salad - chickpeas, celery, black olives, pepitas, avocado, blanched broccoli. Full of crunch & substance, it's a salad that can stand up to a few hours in a container without collapsing.
recipeYield: Serves 2-4, depending on what else is served.
ingredients: 3 handfuls arugula or shredded romaine lettuce
1 small head of broccoli florets, blanched
1-2 tablespoons heavy cream, or to taste

name: Kale Artichoke Dip with Greek Yogurt
ingredients: 1/4 cup dry white wine (*may substitute with chicken broth)

name: Homemade Frozen Bean and Veggie BurritosHomemade Frozen Bean and Cheese Burritos
ingredients: 1 can of black beans, rinsed and drained
1 cup cheese, Cheddar or Pepper Jack
1/2 jar of salsa (using a 6 ounce jar)

name: Buttermilk Berry Muffins
description: Beautiful buttermilk muffins - berry-streaked with sugar-sparkled tops, big flavor, and buttermilk-tender texture.
ingredients: 1 1/4 cups / 5 1/2 oz / 160 g whole wheat pastry flour
2 1/4 cups / 10 1/2 oz / 295 g unbleached all-purpose flour
1/2 cup / 3 1/2 oz / 100 g firmly packed brown sugar
1/2 cup / 4 oz / 115 g unsalted butter, barely melted
1 cup / 4.5 oz / 125 g berries, plus more for topping

name: Cauliflower Pizza Crust Recipe
ingredients: 1 small head of cauliflower, leaves and stems removed
1/2 cup Manchengo sheep milk cheese (or Mozzarella)
cornmeal, to dust the pizza stone

name: Tarta de Santiago Recipe, a Spanish Almond Cake
Cold Soba Noodles
description: Cold soba noodles with a big dollop of ginger-scallion paste for the flight to Tokyo, plus pics from Japan, and a link to a few favorite spots in Tokyo.
ingredients: 5 medium shallots, peeled and finely sliced
scant 1 teaspoon fine grain sea salt
7 tablespoons good sunflower or olive oil

name: Homemade Lara Bars: Coconut Cream Pie
ingredients: 6 medjool dates, pitted and slices in fourths

name: Labneh
description: How a package from Jaipur, India inspired lots of yogurt-straining, labneh-making.

name: Bread sauce
description: This crowd-pleasing bread sauce recipe by Nigella Lawson is an easy extra for Christmas Day and is just as good served cold with leftovers. The recipe appears in Nigella's book Feast, published by Chatto & Windus.

name: Beetroot and ginger chutney
description: Spoon Nigella's beetroot chutney into pretty jars and give it as Christmas presents or keep it for yourself and eat with cheese or cold meats.

name: Cranberry-studded mincemeat
description: Nigella Lawson’s vegetarian mincemeat recipe is packed with port, brandy, spices and dried fruit - what’s not to love?

name: Rocky road crunch bars
description: No one is ever going to complain about having one of these in their lunchbox, and they're pretty handy to have around in a kitchen for a quick, snatched burst of energy at any time.

name: Chocolate fruit cake
description: The prunes in this easy Christmas cake ensure that it is dark, moist and squidgy - but what makes it really special is the chocolate.

name: Chocolate pistachio fudge
description: If I'm not handing this straight round at a party or with coffee after dinner, I might keep half in my freezer, and put the other half in a box or two for Christmas presents. Make sure they stay cold, though.

name: Maple-roast parsnips
description: A generous glug of maple syrup makes all the difference in Nigella Lawson’s easy roast parsnips recipe.

name: Prawns with spicy dipping sauce
description: Be careful with the harissa. Not only do samples vary enormously in strength, but also be aware that some jars that bear the name are not really harissa, but a paste made red with beetroot and carrot.

name: Cinnamon plums with French toast
description: This is a doubly gratifying recipe for the waste-averse: the French toast (a slightly fancier take on the eggy-bread of my childhood) is made with the remains of a loaf otherwise too stale to eat and the cranberry-sharp, cinnamon-scented compôte uses up plums that were bought more in the spirit of optimism than good sense. If you’re lucky enough to have a plum tree, this would gratifyingly use up a glut.

name: Roast squash and sweet potato soup with buttermilk blue cheese sauce
description: I have to have a regular supply of this squash and sweet potato soup at Christmas - it really is one of my freezer favourites.
ingredients: 500g/1lb 2oz sweet potatoes, unpeeled, cut into 2.5cm/1in thick rings
salt and freshly ground black pepper

name: Spaghetti vongole
description: Anchovy paste is a revelation - so useful for adding that little touch of savoury flavour to simple pasta dishes like this.
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper

name: Real guacamole
description: Check out the easy, authentic dip that the Hairy Bikers brought back from their Mexican travels. Serve with nachos.

name: Raw salsa
description: This salsa recipe is a real crowd pleaser – fresh, healthy, low-fat and made in one step. Enjoy with Mexican corn chips.

name: Hot mustard pickle
description: Transform a glut of vegetables into a delicious homemade pickle.

name: Hot chocolate
description: The Hairy Bikers show you how to make a creamy cup of hot chocolate, perfect for a cold winter’s day.
ingredients: 150g/5½oz plain chocolate, chopped into small pieces

name: Lemony pond pudding
description: Try a traditional English dessert with tangy slices of lemon in a rich butterscotch sauce. Serve with double cream or ice cream.

name: Apricot tarte tatin
description: This is an upside-down fruit tart, first cooked by the Tatin sisters at their restaurant in central France. The story goes that it was created by accident but was such a success with the guests that it became a much-loved classic. The apple version is the best known, but apricots work really well too – sunshine on a plate.
ingredients: 375g/13oz sheet of ready-rolled puff pastryplain flour

name: Summer berry cheesecake
description: This easy-peasy cheesecake is quick to make and can be prepared a day in advance – perfect for entertaining.

name: Bubble and squeak and candied shallots
description: Use leftover roast or mashed potatoes and any uneaten greens for a simple solution to Christmas leftovers.
ingredients: sea salt flakes and freshly ground black pepper

name: The best chips you have ever tasted
description: The secret of good chips is to cook them twice at two different temperatures, so you will need a deep pan and a thermometer for this recipe.

name: Prawn cocktail
description: This classic starter gets a punchy update from the Hairy Bikers in the form of fiery central American additions.

name: Gazpacho Hispaniola
description: Easy to throw together, refreshingly moreish and cheap as chips, this chilled soup has everything going for it.
ingredients: 1 litre/1.7 pints eight vegetable-based juice, such as V8 (available from larger supermarkets)

name: Steak pasty
description: Try the Hairy Biker's recipe for a classic steak pasty - these are great to make ahead for a party or picnic.
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper

name: Glamorgan sausages with red onion and chilli relish
description: These vegetarian leek and cheese sausages are delicious and full of flavour. Perfect comfort food.

name: Stuffed butternut squash
description: Easy roast butternut squash topped with spiced, caramelised onions makes a great accompaniment to grilled chicken or sausages.

name: Sweet and sharp sea bass
description: A dazzling little starter for Christmas lunch. Impressive and refreshing, this recipe uses fresh citrus juice to ‘cold cook’ the fish – so no actual cooking needed. Make a few hours or a day ahead.

name: Lamb hotpot
description: Nigel Slater's version of the traditional hotpot is lighter than many and a perfect pick-me-up on a cold day.
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper

name: Sticky chicken thighs with lemon and honey
ingredients: good squeeze or two of runny honey

name: Fresh mackerel with roasted rhubarb
description: Believe it or not, this is a classic combination. Tart rhubarb cuts through the richness of smoky, oily mackerel for a perfect spring supper.
ingredients: good shake of light brown sugar
a couple of good glugs of fruity olive oil

name: Real mint sauce
description: Mint grows so freely that once you know the trick you never need buy mint sauce again.

name: Green tomato chutney
description: Use up green tomatoes from your garden with this tasty chutney recipe - it’s delicious on a cheese sandwich.

name: Tomato chutney
description: James Martin's quick and easy tomato chutney is a cinch to whip up for burgers or a veggie curry.

name: BBQ sauce
description: The perfect accompaniment for any barbecue - slather it on sausages and burgers.

name: Rhubarb panna cotta with roasted rhubarb
description: Tangy roasted rhubarb is a perfect match for this light, creamy Italian dessert. Make it a day ahead for a fuss-free pudding to round off a special meal.

name: Lemon syllabub
description: A bit of a cheat this syllabub, using ready-made lemon curd... but so delicious, you don't need to tell anyone.

name: Sautéed potatoes with lemon and rosemary
description: If making the sautéed potatoes ahead of time, keep warm in a low oven and squeeze over the lemon just before serving.
ingredients: sea salt and freshly ground black pepper

name: Kedgeree
description: James Martin's kedgeree is perfect for a weekend brunch and on the table in half an hour.
ingredients: sea salt and cracked black pepper
good pinch cayenne and freshly ground nutmeg

name: Gefilte Fish Recipe
description: This easy and fresh-tasting take on a classic gefilte fish recipe will brighten up the Passover table.
ingredients: 1 cup large-dice yellow onion (from about 1 medium onion)
1/3 cup peeled and large-dice carrot (from about 1/2 medium carrot)
1/3 cup peeled and large-dice parsnip (from about 1/2 medium parsnip)
2-1/2-pound mix of skinned white mild-flavored fish fillets , such as cod, halibut, pike, or grouper
1 teaspoon packed, finely grated lemon zest (from about 1 medium lemon)
4 teaspoons  kosher salt , plus more as needed
1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper , plus more as needed

name: Pasta with Broccoli, Crispy Prosciutto, and Toasted Breadcrumbs Recipe
description: An easy and fast pasta recipe with broccoli and crispy prosciutto.
ingredients: 1 pound  broccoli crowns, cut into bite-size pieces
1 pound dried short pasta , such as penne or rotini
4 ounces thinly sliced prosciutto , small dice
Freshly grated Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese , for serving

name: Damson cobbler
description: Rick Stein uses a food processor to whizz together the topping for his sticky damson cobbler - it's up to the oven to do the hard work.

name: Fast Lemon-Parsley Shrimp Pasta Recipe
description: A quick pasta recipe with linguine and shrimp tossed in a lemon-, garlic-, and red pepper flake–infused butter sauce.
ingredients: 1 1/2 pounds large shrimp , peeled, deveined, and patted dry
4 tablespoons  unsalted butter (1/2 stick), cut into 4 pieces
1 teaspoon finely grated lemon zest (from about 1 medium lemon)
1/3 cup coarsely chopped fresh Italian parsley leaves
Finely grated Parmesan cheese , for serving (optional)

name: Meringues with clotted cream and strawberries
description: Rick Stein shows how to make the ultimate meringue in this simple eight-step recipe.

name: Celery Margarita Recipe
description: This celery margarita recipe combines celery juice, lime juice, silver tequila, and Lillet Blanc (Blonde) for a crisp and refreshing cocktail.
ingredients: 6  celery stalks , washed, trimmed, and cut into 1-inch pieces
4 ounces freshly squeezed lime juice (from about 4 medium limes)
4 tender celery stalks with leaves (from within the bunch), trimmed to fit the glass, for garnish

name: Smoked and Steamed Salmon Rillettes Recipe
description: Pernod-steamed salmon and smoked salmon are mixed with a lemony butter–crème fraîche dressing in this lighter take on rillettes.
ingredients: 1 (20-ounce) skin-on salmon fillet (1 1/4 pounds), pin bones removed
3 teaspoons  kosher salt , plus more as needed
1/2 teaspoon freshly ground white pepper , plus more as needed
3 sticks unsalted butter , at room temperature
1/2 cup finely chopped shallots (from about 2 medium shallots)
4 ounces  smoked salmon , small dice and at room temperature
3 tablespoons freshly squeezed lemon juice (from about 1 1/2 medium lemons)
Baguette, crackers , or crostini, for serving

name: The Corsican Cocktail Recipe
description: A light and refreshing cocktail recipe made with limoncello, Lillet Blanc, and elderflower syrup to enjoy on a picnic or at a barbecue.

name: Passover Orange Angel Food Cake with Strawberries Recipe
description: Lighten things up this Passover and finish the meal off with a kosher angel food cake, made with matzo cake meal and potato starch. Served with orange-soaked...
ingredients: 4 teaspoons packed orange zest, from 2 medium
12 large egg whites (1 1/2 cups), at room temperature
3 pints strawberries (about 2 pounds), hulled and thinly sliced

name: Crispy Prosciutto-Wrapped Asparagus Recipe
description: A simple appetizer recipe with thin slices of prosciutto wrapped around fresh asparagus spears and broiled until crispy.
ingredients: 34 medium asparagus spears, ends trimmed (about 1 1/2 pounds)
17 thin slices prosciutto , cut in half lengthwise (about 7 ounces)

name: Tarragon Chicken Salad Recipe
description: This chicken salad recipe has roasted chicken mixed with tart apple, onion, tarragon, and mayonnaise for an elegant salad served over greens or as a sandwich.
ingredients: 2  whole chicken legs (thigh and drumstick, about 1 1/2 pounds)
1 cup small-dice tart apple , such as Braeburn, Granny Smith, or Gravenstein
2/3 cup small-dice celery (from about 2 medium celery stalks)

name: Pumpkin ravioli with sage butter
description: Impress your friends with Rick Stein’s homemade pumpkin ravioli – perfect for a show off dinner party dish.

name: Easy Blender Hollandaise Sauce Recipe
description: A simple blender version of the classic lemon-and-butter-sauce recipe to top eggs Benedict, vegetables, or fish.

name: Prosciutto Palmiers Recipe
description: Prosciutto and Gruyère are folded into buttery puff pastry that's been brushed with tomato paste, for an easy, elegant appetizer recipe.
ingredients: 1 (14- to 16-ounce package) frozen puff pastry , thawed according to the package directions

name: Strawberry Syrup Recipe
description: A simple recipe for strawberry syrup made with real strawberries, to use in cocktails, sodas, or desserts.

name: Easy Spinach Dal (Dhal, Dhall) Recipe
description: A comforting Indian spinach dal recipe of yellow split peas and spinach flavored with butter infused with cumin, turmeric, garlic, ginger, and serrano chile.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons freshly squeezed lemon juice (from about 1 medium lemon)
2 teaspoons  kosher salt , plus more as needed
5 medium garlic cloves , peeled and finely chopped
1/4 cup peeled and finely chopped fresh ginger (from about a 4-inch piece)
1 medium serrano chile, stemmed and finely chopped
8 ounces  baby spinach , washed and coarsely chopped

name: Patatas bravas
description: Patatas bravas as they should be: crisp, olive oil-fried potatoes topped with a tomato sauce, well-flavoured with hot pimentón and sharpened with a little vinegar.
ingredients: 1 tsp pimentón picante (smoked hot Spanish paprika

name: Warm, Cheesy Swiss Chard and Roasted Garlic Dip Recipe
description: A warm dip recipe made with fresh Swiss chard, roasted garlic, and fontina cheese, with a crispy pine nut and panko topping.
ingredients: 8 ounces  cream cheese , at room temperature
1/2 cup  sour cream , at room temperature
1/2 teaspoon  kosher salt , plus more as needed
1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper , plus more as needed

name: Lettuce, anchovy and egg salad with a creamy vinaigrette
description: Use the best quality anchovies you can find for this simple salad recipe.
ingredients: 50g/2oz (about 12) large anchovy fillets in olive oil, drained and cut on the diagonal into 2.5cm/1in pieces
salt and freshly ground black pepper
50g/2oz (about 12) large anchovy fillets in olive oil, drained and cut on the diagonal into 2.5cm/1in pieces
salt and freshly ground black pepper

name: Fennel sausages braised with lemony potatoes and bay leaves
description: The perfect sausages for this dish are those from specialist Italian or Continental delicatessens, luganega, which come in one long length. If you are using ordinary sausages, add a teaspoon of fennel seeds to the onions when frying.
ingredients: 450g/1lb luganega sausages (available from specialist Italian or Continental grocers), or other nice meaty pork chipolatas
750g/1½lb small waxy potatoes, peeled and each cut into quarters
salt and freshly ground black pepper

name: Pollo alla Valdostana (Chicken with Prosciutto and Fontina Cheese) Recipe
description: This recipe for boneless, skinless chicken breasts has fontina cheese and prosciutto in a wine sauce for a fast and easy weeknight dinner.
ingredients: 2 to 3 ounces thinly sliced fontina cheese

name: Ruby on Rails Cocktail Recipe
description: Sliced strawberries, strawberry syrup, and rosé wine make this cocktail recipe light and fruity, while Pimm's and gin add herbal complexity.
ingredients: 2 or 3 medium strawberries , hulled and thinly sliced

name: Spaghetti alla carbonara
description: Try Rick Stein's recipe for a classic, creamy carbonara.
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper

name: Pumpkin and coconut loaf cake
description: Make the most of pumpkin’s sweetness for this delicious loaf recipe.

name: Valentine cupcakes
description: Make these light-as-a-feather cupcakes with their pretty pink decoration for someone you love.

name: Vanilla panna cotta
description: Try this easy recipe for creamy panna cotta served with a simple raspberry sauce.

name: Seared Scallops with Lemony Farro and Arugula Salad Recipe
description: This healthy recipe for seared scallops is served atop a warm lemon-garlic farro salad tossed with peppery arugula.
ingredients: 2 teaspoons  kosher salt , plus more as needed
1 teaspoon finely grated lemon zest (from about 1 medium lemon)
1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper , plus more as needed
3 ounces  baby arugula , washed and coarsely chopped

name: Hot cross bun bread and butter pudding
description: If you're stuck with less than fresh hot cross buns, soak them in gorgeous eggy custard for an Easter monday pud.

name: Rice Pilaf Recipe
description: The classic rice pilaf recipe with rice, onion, garlic, butter, chicken broth, and parsley.
ingredients: 2 cups stock or low-sodium chicken broth
1 1/4 teaspoons  kosher salt , plus more as needed
1/4 cup finely chopped fresh Italian parsley leaves

name: Banoffee pie
description: Full of all things naughty, banoffee pie is irresistible. To save time, use bought dulce de leche instead of making your own caramel.

name: Monkey Bread (Pluckets) Recipe
description: A sweet yeasted bread recipe that's buttery and rich, with a cinnamon, nutmeg, and sugar glaze.
ingredients: 6 tablespoons  unsalted butter (3/4 stick), cut into 6 pieces and at room temperature
Vegetable oil or cooking spray, for coating the bowl
10 tablespoons  unsalted butter (1 1/4 sticks), melted and cooled

name: Toffee apple crumble
description: Toffee adds a decadent twist to a classic apple crumble. Serve with lashings of custard.

name: Easy Glazed Carrots Recipe
description: An easy carrot recipe with a rich, tangy sauce balanced by the flavors of butter, brown sugar, Dijon mustard, and white wine vinegar.
ingredients: 2 pounds  carrots , peeled and cut on the bias 1/4 inch thick

name: Short Ribs with Frisée-Parsley Salad Recipe
description: Rich, tender ribs complemented by a fresh, slightly bitter salad.
ingredients: 2 1/2 pounds  beef short ribs (about 3 English cut), trimmed of excess fat and cut into 3- to 4-inch pieces

name: Sweetcorn fritters with homemade ketchup
description: These simple fritters make a decadent brunch with some crisp bacon or a simple supper.
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
salt and freshly ground black pepper

name: Huevos rancheros (ranch-style eggs)
description: Try a Mexican-inspired brunch with this healthy egg and spicy tomato dish. It's ready in a flash too.
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
2 soft flour / corn tortillas, warmed in the oven

name: Veggie kedgeree
description: Veggie black pudding is worth seeking out for a really special breakfast treat. Combine with hard boiled eggs and savoury rice.

name: French Lentil Terrine with Savory Carrot Custard Recipe
description: Sautéed leeks and zucchini are layered over creamy chèvre-coated lentils and a savory carrot custard in this French-inspired vegetarian terrine.
ingredients: 8 ounces  carrots (about 3 medium), peeled and small dice
1 1/2 teaspoons  kosher salt , plus more as needed
1 pound plus 10 ounces  leeks (about 2 medium), quartered lengthwise and thinly sliced crosswise (white and light green parts only)
1 teaspoon finely chopped fresh thyme leaves
10 ounces  zucchini (about 2 medium), trimmed and small dice
1 cup  French green lentils , also known as lentilles du Puy, rinsed
1 medium garlic clove , smashed and peeled

name: Seared salmon and chorizo salad
description: The smoky, paprika flavour of chorizo adds a spicy kick to this healthy salmon salad.

name: Dukkah lamb cutlets with quinoa salad
description: This quick recipe is a lifesaver for midweek suppers. The dry dukkah spice mix is also great as a dip for flatbreads.
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
salt and freshly ground black pepper

name: Chorizo, chicken and chickpea casserole
description: Simon Rimmer's Spanish style one-pot supper is full of flavour and quick to prepare.
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper

name: Butter chicken
description: A mild, creamy curry that's sure to please all tastes. Don't be put off by the long list of ingredients - it's very easy to make.
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper

name: Strawberry-Blueberry Crisp Baked in a Jar Recipe
description: This recipe for strawberries and blueberries covered with a crunchy almond topping bakes right in its own single-serving jar and makes a fun picnic dessert.
ingredients: 2 cups fresh strawberries , washed, hulled, and quartered (about 11 ounces)
1/3 cup  slivered almonds (about 1 1/2 ounces), finely chopped
3 tablespoons cold unsalted butter , cut into 6 pieces

name: Chocolate éclairs
description: Raymond Blanc's recipe for chocolate éclairs is full of tips and advice, including how to freeze.
ingredients: 450g/1lb pastry cream (crème patissière), at room temperature (see Top recipe tip below)

name: Apple tart 'Maman Blanc'
description: A simple tart topped with buttery soft apples, cream and calvados - takes no time to make, but is so delicious.
ingredients: 3-4 Cox's Orange Pippin, Worcester, Russet or Braeburn apples

name: Hot smoked salmon, beetroot salad and horseradish crème fraîche
description: This easy salad requires only a little cooking, but tastes sensational.  If you can't find fresh horseradish, you can add fresh dill to a jar of ready-made horseradish cream.

name: Cheese and ham omelette
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper

name: Chicken Breasts Stuffed with Prosciutto and Gruyère Cheese (Chicken Cordon Bleu) Recipe
description: Like chicken cordon bleu, this recipe stuffs boneless, skinless chicken breasts with prosciutto and Gruyère cheese and bakes them until hot and oozy.
ingredients: 4 ounces  Gruyère cheese , thinly sliced into 3-by-1-inch planks
